channel.title: News on Nautilus Project
channel.description: Recent content in News on Nautilus Project

item.title: Nautilus @ 8ᵗʰ Scientific Meeting of the FESN & the 2nd Panhellenic Conference on Neuropsychology
item.description: Nautilus project presented three works at the 8ᵗʰ Scientific Meeting of the FESN & the 2nd Panhellenic Conference on Neuropsychology in Thessaloniki.

item.title: Nautilus @ 11ᵗʰ Meeting on Visual and Physiological Optics
item.description: Nautilus project presented a work at the 11ᵗʰ Meeting on Visual and Physiological Optics in Antwerp.

item.title: Eye movements in patients with post-COVID condition
item.description: A new paper has been published in Biomedical Optics Express journal titled Eye movements in patients with post-COVID condition.

item.title: Nautilus @ 76th Spring Meeting of the Catalan Society of Neuropsychology
item.description: Nautilus project presented a work at the 76th Spring Meeting of the Catalan Society of Neuropsychology in Barcelona.

item.title: Nautilus @ Congreso Nacional de Neuropsicología 2023
item.description: Nautilus project presented three posters at the XIV Congreso Nacional de Neuropsicología 2023 in Madrid.

item.title: COVID‐19 severity is related to poor executive function in people with post‐COVID conditions
item.description: A new paper has been published in Journal of Neurology journal titled COVID-19 severity is related to poor executive function in people with post-COVID conditions.

item.title: Nautilus podcast at PsicoEspai
item.description: The Official College of Psychology in Lleida podcast PsicoEspai has published a podcast where Nautilus has been presented. The Cognitive Disorders Unit of Lleida, at the University Hospital of Santa Maria de Lleida, is one of the 24 centers that are part of the NAUTILUS project to promote an artificial intelligence platform to study the cognitive sequelae of people who have suffered from COVID-19. “Cognition, emotion/behavior, functionality and brain connectivity in patients recovered from COVID-19 (NAUTILUS)” is the name of the project led by the Consorci Sanitari de Terrassa, the University of Barcelona (UB) and the Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC ), which was funded in the last call for the Marathon (among other grants).

item.title: Nautilus at LaVozdDigital and Universitat Oberta de Catalunya
item.description: Maite Garolera has been interviewed by LaVozDigital and Universitat Oberta de Catalunya to share her experience in Nautilus. Garolera talks about the cognitive effects of COVID-19, which are mild but have a significant social and economic impact. Moreover, she explains that some people who have recovered from COVID-19 experience brain fog, which is a difficulty in concentrating and focusing thoughts that can interfere with memory and learning. She says that the project will use artificial intelligence tools to try to predict which people are at risk of developing cognitive impairments and to understand the causes and mechanisms behind them.

item.title: Nautilus at CaixaForum Madrid
item.description: Maite Garolera has presented Nautilus at CaixaForum Madrid in the workshop Neurological Effects and Neuropsychological Alterations due to COVID-19. Garolera presented Nautilus with the mission to try to understand what happens with cognition and how covid affects the central nervous system. Preliminary results from observational studies indicate that people who have been in the ICU have more serious cognitive problems. Regarding the affected domains, executive function, information processing speed and social cognition stand out above all.

item.title: Neuropsychological impairment in post-COVID condition individuals with and without cognitive complaints
item.description: A new paper has been published in Frontiers in Aging Neuroscience journal titled Neuropsychological impairment in post-COVID condition individuals with and without cognitive complaints.

item.title: Nautilus @ International Neuropsychological Society 2022 Meeting
item.description: Nautilus project presented three posters at the International Neuropsychological Society 2022 Meeting in Barcelona.

item.title: Nautilus highlighted at regional press
item.description: Nautilus project has started the first press outreach activities showcasing the project in several regional news media. Segre Nació Digital LaMañana Photo by AbsolutVision on Unsplash

item.title: Kick Off!
item.description: On the 3th of February 2021, the kick-off meeting of the NAUTILUS project took place at the premises of the Fundació Joan Costa Roma in Consorci Sanitari de Terrassa. Researchers from the different consortium members and supporting clinical centers met to kick off the project and discuss the study to be performed and agree on the different protocols and tasks. This meeting will guide the research actions in the coming months and support selecting participants in the study tests1.

item.title: NAUTILUS a la Jornada Consecuencias Psicológicas de la Pandemia
item.description: Dr. Maite Garolera participates in the presentation Neuropsychology and Post-COVID: the Project NAUTILUS at the conference Psychological Consequences of the Pandemic: From different areas disciplines and fields of action in Psychology organized by the Official College of Psychology of Madrid on October 14, 2022. Programme can be found here.

item.title: Nautilus at Salut Mental 360
item.description: Mar Ariza and Neus Cano researchers of C3-CST group have contributed to Salut Mental 360 portal with a blog post about Nautilus project. The blog post discusses the effects of COVID-19 on the brain, including potential cognitive and mental health issues. It also highlights the importance of research in this area, as well as the need for further understanding of the long-term consequences of COVID-19 on the brain and mental health.
